task.title: Isolating the master host in a separate resource pool

context.note: If you are configuring a single-host deployment, skip this procedure.
context.p: enables or just performs rapid recovery from application service failures. When internal services and application services share a host, application failures can limit recovery options. strongly recommends isolating the master host in a separate resource pool.
This procedure creates a new resource pool for the master host, and then adds the master host to the pool.

step.cmd: Log in to the master host .
Create a new resource pool named master.
Add the master host to the master resource pool.

stepxmp.p: Replace Hostname-Or-IP with the hostname or IP address of the master host:
If you enter a hostname, all hosts in your cluster must be able to resolve the name, either through an entry in /etc/hosts, or through a nameserver on your network.
